meanings.definition: To inform against someone; to betray
meanings.sent1: She was peaching on her friend to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent2: He regretted peaching on his colleague to the boss.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was peaching on its owner to the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The spy was peaching on his country for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The student was caught peaching on the cheating classmates.

meanings.definition: To speak or preach in a forceful or self-righteous manner
meanings.sent1: The politician was peaching about honesty in public service.
meanings.sent2: The preacher was peaching to the congregation about forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: The child was peaching to his toys about sharing.
meanings.sent4: The coach was peaching on teamwork to the players.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was peaching on the importance of education to the students.

meanings.definition: To disclose confidential information or secrets
meanings.sent1: She accidentally started peaching about the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: He was peaching about the company's upcoming merger.
meanings.sent3: The cat was peaching about the hiding spot of the treats.
meanings.sent4: The leak was peaching on the new product launch.
meanings.sent5: The gossip was peaching on the celebrity's scandalous affair.
